Class Service

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Helpdesk, Session

    public abstract class Service
extends java.lang.Object
    Service class An abstract class which all the other Service API wrappers extend. If you are going to create a new API wrapper extend the Service class.
    Author:
    rich

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Service(Connection connection, java.lang.String service)
      Populate the required connection and service parameters

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Request generateRequest(java.lang.String method)
      Generates a new Request with the session specified in the constructor and a method provided when called.
      Response invoke(Request request)
      Send the request to the server via the connection provided in the constructor.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Service

        protected Service(Connection connection,
                  java.lang.String service)
        Populate the required connection and service parameters
        Parameters:
        connection - represents a connection to the server. Connection
        service - the name of the service that this API wraps, for example "session"

    • Method Detail

      • generateRequest

        public Request generateRequest(java.lang.String method)
        Generates a new Request with the session specified in the constructor and a method provided when called.
        Parameters:
        method - the method of the service this API wraps see xmlmc documentation for details
        Returns:
        new Request
        See Also:
        Request

      • invoke

        public Response invoke(Request request)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Send the request to the server via the connection provided in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        request - A request to be sent
        Returns:
        new Response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        generateRequest(String), Response
